title: Audi Q3 Sportback review: this coupé-style SUV is good-looking and refined – but beware the premium price
text:
The march of Audi’s indecipherable model naming system continues. This, the Q3 Sportback, is a sort-of coupé version of the Q3 SUV; these coupé SUV/crossovers are a mainly German sub-model niche chasing like a forlorn defender in the Rugby World Cup against the wing three-quarter that is the Range Rover Evoque.

Yet when applied to the Q3’s civilian sister the A3, the Sportback name denotes a larger and more practical five-door version, although there’s nothing more practical about this version of the Q3. To confuse matters still further, you might expect the coupé version of the Q3 to take the next number up as it does with the Q8, which is a coupé version of the Q7 SUV, but not in this instance....
description: The march of Audi’s indecipherable model naming system continues.
